content.description: A ball is dropped and bounces off the floor. Its speed is the same immediately before and immediately after the collision.
content.question: Which of the following is true about the collision between the ball and the floor?

choices.label: The ball’s momentum changes direction but not magnitude.
The ball’s momentum changes magnitude but not direction.
The impulse delivered to the ball by the floor is zero.
The impulse delivered to the floor by the ball is zero.

content.answer: The ball’s momentum changes direction but not magnitude.

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
